abstract: Asked about recent reports that Bank of America was in talks that might lead to an acquisition of Countrywide, Bank of America Chief Executive Kenneth Lewis said Wednesday his company would follow a mortgage strategy of “organic growth.” Speaking at a financial-services conference, he also said the odds were “pretty low” that his company would buy a large United States bank this year, Reuters reported.

headline.main: BofA Chief Says Big U.S. Deal Is Unlikely
